description: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy reveals endometrioid adenocarcinoma with superficial myometrial invasion (<50%), extension to the endocervical junction without stromal invasion, and mucosal involvement of the right fallopian tube; no lymphovascular or cervical stromal invasion and negative margins.
patient_notes: You have a type of uterine cancer called endometrioid adenocarcinoma. The cancer was removed by surgery and was found to have only superficial invasion and some involvement of the fallopian tube. Your care team recommends chemotherapy and may add pelvic radiation and internal vaginal therapy to reduce the risk of recurrence. This approach aims to eliminate any remaining cancer cells and improve your outcome.

verification.assessment: The extracted staging of FIGO IIIA and pT3a pNx M0 is accurate, reflecting superficial myometrial invasion with adnexal (fallopian tube) involvement per NCCN criteria.
